title: Spam "Reply To" blacklist filter not working
content:
I've been getting a lot of spam the past few months, so have been working on filtering the true spam from new senders of email who are marked as Junk email.

To do this filtering, I've been using "From" blacklist filtering, and it seems to work well. But spammers are clever and this technique often doesn't work, so I'm now using "Reply To" filtering. It works sometimes but often doesn't work. Specifically, when I use a "Reply To" blacklist filter of ".3.", and then click to manually run the spam filtering, it usually doesn't work. It did once. I'm puzzled as to why it usually doesn't work.
creator: Don-Peters

title: All day calender events move back one day
content:
Use Tbsync to synchronize (shaw) exchange calendar. Everything working great just have a weird problem.

When I create an all day event it gets stored in the correct day, then, after some time (like the next day) I observe the event has moved back one day?!

I suspect on way to resolve is to do a complete re-install of thunderbird. Seems like upgrading to tb115 is a good time? I assume a new profile will be called for BUT how to preserve messages etc.

Thanks for your help.
creator: peterawolfe1

title: Transfer calendar settings to another install
content:
We use o365 at my work, and my dept has a group calendar. I have it working fine on my work system which is a fedora box, but my home computer with win 11 I cant remember what I did to make it work.

I tried exporting the calendar to a ical file on the working system but it just copied the events, it couldnt see new events in the calendar.

Is there a way to export the settings from one thunderbird install to another?

title: Attachment not visible on some emails
content: Hello, sometimes I receive an email with attachment, but attachments are not visible within the client. The message source show there is an attachment (see attached image #1) If open the webmail I can see the attachment (see attached image #2). Up to now it happened only with pdf file (see attached image #3). I found a thread named "Thunderbird not showing attachments", that report the same issue, but the proposed solution is neither solving nor applicable to my PC. If needed, I can forward the email, there are no privacy issues. Thank you very much! Daniele

title: Automate spam checking and unify it with inbox
content:
I have several email accounts in Thunderbird. As expected, it regularly checks the inbox in each of them and downloads the messages, this is fine. I would like it to do the same with ALL the folders, including the spam. How can this be done?

In the attached screenshots you can see my settings. For the sake of comfort, I have created a "saved search" that groups all the inboxes of each account, and I would like to find there all the spam folders as well (within the "inbox all" saved search), because still in 2023 the filters from the companies cannot be trusted, you end up missing a lot of important emails and even worse they cannot be deactivated, not even in premium corporate accounts. The thing is that each time I go to any of these saved searches they work fine, but for some reason they ignore the spam folders. If, within Thunderbird, I go to manually check each spam folder, then it downloads the messages and now they show up in the saved search. However, the process of Thunderbird connecting to the remote spam folder and downloading the messages is not automated when I go into the saved search. What am I missing?
creator: m.senger

title: Some emails from Microsoft Exchange are not received with POP3
content:
Some incoming emails do not appear in my Thunderbird Inbox. The mail environment is as follows.

Server: Microsoft Exchange Mailer: Thunderbird Receiving protocol: POP3

They are not in the spam folder. This problem is occurring with some emails from a specific domain. Several people are experiencing the same problem.

Also, Outlook on the Web and IMAP can be used to view the messages.

Is there a possible reason why some emails are not showing up in POP3 and what can be done about it?
creator: karibe.haruka

title: Unfavorite A Favorited Folder
content: Hi! Currently getting Thunderbird set up, and I accidentally favorited some folders that I didn't need to. I see no option to "unfavorite" them - is that possible? Thanks!
creator: bluedragonnine

title: Thunderbird on ARM64
content: I've seen ARM64 listed as a Tier 2 platform in a thread a couple years ago. I'm here to ask that Thunderbird PLEASE be ported to Windows on ARM64 already. The x86-64 version runs PAINFULLY slowly on ARM64. The big problem appears to be the code that adds newly downloaded emails to the email database file; it can take up to a minute per email, and it makes Thunderbird excruciating to use on my Samsung Galaxy Book S. Firefox, being available in a native ARM64 binary, runs brilliantly, so I know it's possible for Mozilla to pull this off. Please do it already.
creator: deusexaethera

title: TB Keeps checking a deleted account.
content:
I removed an IMAP type account hosted at Google domains.

It is not on the list of accounts, yet, every 10 minutes, and at startup, it tries to connect, with the obvious error messages.

How can I stop it?

Linux Mint 21 Thunderbird 102.13.0 (64-bit)
creator: mike661
